meanings.definition: A person who complains or expresses discontent in a peevish or irritating way.
meanings.sent1: The little whiner always finds something to complain about.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to deal with a whiner in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The whiner at the restaurant kept sending back his food.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the office whiner, constantly grumbling about everything.
meanings.sent5: The toddler turned into a whiner whenever he didn't get his way.

meanings.definition: To complain or express discontent in a peevish or irritating way.
meanings.sent1: Stop whining and do something about it.
meanings.sent2: She tends to whine whenever things don't go her way.
meanings.sent3: The dog started to whine when it saw its favorite toy out of reach.
meanings.sent4: The wind whined through the cracks in the old window.
meanings.sent5: He would always whine about having to do his chores.
